intro: Cichorium saticum, commonly known as endive, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its curly, bitter leaves that can be either green or white, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces blue or purple flowers. It is cultivated for its edible leaves, which are used in salads, and for its edible roots, which are used to make chicory. Cichorium saticum thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
